moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 d5 4. Nf3 c6 5: All the games start here, in this themed mini.
moves.13... Nxe4 14. Bxe4 f5 15. Bd3: The exchange leaves a peaceful-looking position...
moves.15... c5 16. dxc5: I don't want my opponent's Q side pawns to storm forward, so I exchange one off.
moves.16... Nxc5 17. Be2: I'd rather not give up a minor exchange without a reason.
moves.17... e5 18. Bc3: I switch my Bishop to a more active diagonal, pointing toward Black's King.
moves.19... Nb3 20. Qe1: And again. My opponent in this game also played for the attack.
moves.20... Bc6 21. Rb1: I'm not sure why my opponent didn't play 20... NxR, but I'm glad of a chance to slide my Rook clear.
moves.21... e4 22. Ng5: I have to move my Knight, allowing Black to win a Pawn.
moves.23... Be5 24. f4: I act quickly to seal the dangerous diagonal.
moves.24... Bf6 25. Qh4: I elect to launch a counterattack. The immediate threat is QxP mate.
moves.25... h6 26. Ne6: Black *could* choose here to exchange Queens [26... BxQ 27 NxQ] but elects not to.
moves.26... Qd6 27. Bxf6: The Queens remain, but some of the wood does come off.
moves.28... Nd2 29. Nxf5: A mistake, as Black can simply play RxN and still has my Rooks forked with his own Knight.
moves.29... Qe6 30. Nd4: Black fails to take advantage, and I harass his Q again.
moves.30... Qd5 31. Rbd1: I remove one of my Rooks from attack.
moves.31... Nc4 32. Nxc6: Having equalized the material, I begin swapping off the minor pieces.
moves.32... Qxc6 33. Bxc4+: The last minor falls, leaving a Q and 2 R end game.
moves.33... bxc4 34. Qe1: Bringing my Q back towards the center of the board.
moves.36... c3 37. bxc3: Black pushes, and I trade Pawns.
moves.37... Qxc3 38. a4: My own QRP was under fire.
moves.38... Qxe3 39. Rxe4: Another pair of Pawns leave the board. Black again has the chance to exchange Queens...
moves.39... Qg3 40. Qf2: ... and does not. He is clearly trying to geenerate a mating attack.
moves.40... Qg4 41. Qc2: I bring my Q to an open area and attack the R.
moves.41... Rg3 42. Re8+: Now I go on the attack.
moves.43... Rxf4 44. Re1e7+: I willingly give up a Pawn to generate a dangerous attack, looking to mate.
moves.45... Kf5 46. Rf8+: I force the Black K to the KN file, enabling me to win Black's Q.
moves.46... Kg5 47. Rxg7+: Black's own aggressive play has led to this position.
moves.47... Kh5 48. Rxg4: I of course seize the chance to win the Q.
